Comment_contributor: [litː 'one hand and (going to the other) one']
(litː 'one hand and three'), neʔ in the old data is adverbalizer which is not obligatory.
(litː 'one hand and the finger before the thumb')

Comment_glosser: ‘man one’; this form is also given for 20, suggesting either an error or a lack of conventionalization (perhaps a transition from vigesimal to decimal counting)
‘hand two and one’ (?) or ‘hand two and foot going one’ (?)
‘man one and hand one’ (it is unclear whether “man” signifies 10 or 20)

Comment_contributor: (litː 'four hands', -kpaʔ 'name or one' is mistaken representation of kpahaʔ 'not')

Comment_glosser: ‘man one’; this form is also given for 10, suggesting either an error or a lack of conventionalization (perhaps a transition from vigesimal to decimal counting)
